senses.sense_definition: Of or relating to the ancient region of Achaea or its inhabitants.

examples.text: The <w>Achaean</w> League was a significant confederation of city-states in the Hellenistic period.
Archaeologists have uncovered distinct <w>Achaean</w> pottery styles in the northern Peloponnese.

traits.comment: refers to the specific region of Achaea

senses.sense_definition: Relating to Greece or the Greeks in general, particularly in the context of the Mycenaean era or Homeric epics.

examples.text: The <w>Achaean</w> ships gathered at Aulis before sailing to Troy.
Homer describes the <w>Achaean</w> heroes with great detail in the Iliad.

senses.sense_definition: An inhabitant of the region of Achaea or a member of the ancient Hellenic tribe associated with it.

examples.text: The <w>Achaeans</w> established several colonies in southern Italy.
As an <w>Achaean</w>, he felt a strong loyalty to the league of cities.

senses.sense_definition: A Greek person, specifically one from the Mycenaean era as described in Homeric literature.

examples.text: The <w>Achaeans</w> besieged the city of Troy for ten long years.
Odysseus was considered one of the most cunning of the <w>Achaeans</w>.
